metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45078 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
stab_xcoff_builtin_type in stabs.c in GNU Binutils through 2.37 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by an out-of-bounds write. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2018-12699.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-common - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-for-build - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-for-host - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-multiarch - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-source - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
libbinutils - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
libctf0 - 2.34-6ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> binutils isn't safe for untrusted inputs. mdeslaur> reproducer doesn't crash objdump without ASAN on bionic and focal

criterions.comment: binutils package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34-6ubuntu1.6').
